Bio

Related

Stats

Biography

Career

After spending three years at Lake Superior State, finished his collegiate career at Merrimack as a graduate transfer in 2018-19

Added a veteran presence to the blue line during his one season in North Andover

Overall, appeared in 116 games while posting 11 points (2g, 9a)

2018-19

Was a regular in the lineup as a graduate transfer, playing in all but one of the team's 34 games while adding a veteran presence to the blue line

Scored one goal while finishing with 19 shots on goal

That goal came against UMass (10/26)

Posted a season-high three shots against Colorado College (12/31)

Before Merrimack

Joined the program as a graduate transfer from Lake Superior State University (WCHA)

Logged over 80 appearances over three years for the Lakers, amassing 10 points (1g, 9a) in that span

2017-18: Played in 17 games, recording two assists with 13 shots on net while blocking 27 shots

2016-17: Was in the lineup all 36 games, distributing five assists while finishing with 17 shots on goal and blocking 52 shots, tied for third-most on the team

2015-16: Appeared in 30 games as a collegiate rookie, finishing with a goal and two assists and 31 blocks, good for fifth on the team

Before Lake Superior State

Played in 41 games for the Fargo Force in 2014-15, totaling a 1-5--6 scoring line

Was traded to the Sioux City Musketeers late in the 2014-15 season and collected three assists in 14 games

In 2013-14, split time between the Muskegon Lumberjacks of the USHL and the Rio Grande Valley Killer Bees of the NAHL

Personal

Born July 11, 1995

Son of Melinda and Peter McArdle

Brother to Shea

Plans to major in Business Management

CAREER HIGHS

Points: 1, at Massachusetts, 10/26/18

Goals: 1, at Massachusetts, 10/26/18

Shots: 3, Colorado College, Dec 31, 2018

Penalties: 1, 11 times

Penalty minutes: 2, 11 times

Plus/minus: 1, 4 times
